intro: Calytrix stipulosa, commonly known as the silky mallow, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Calytrix stipulosa is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
